reviews.text: The staff was GREAT! The room was very clean. Wifi worked flawlessly. Really enjoyed the breakfast and game room. Nice and quiet!
reviews.title: Would Definitely Stay here again

reviews.text: I've stayed in the Days Inn(not good), the Lancaster Host (which is right across the street from the Gardenspot and was decent) and another motel down the street (I can't remember the name but it's next to the Texas Roadhouse and it was fine). But I found the Garden Spot to be a great place to stay and at a good price. I attend a yearly convention at the Lancaster Host but it's always packed over there and priced higher. The Garden Spot was a very pleasant surprise for us when we first stayed there in the summer of 2008. The rooms were very nice and clean, as was the bathroom. The cafe/restaurant was excellent, at least for breakfast as that's all we even went there for.
reviews.title: My first choice in Lancaster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a friendly, comfortable stay you will never find anyplace better. Family owned,(you can tell by the care of the place) Great little breakfast cafe..Can't wait for another visit..
reviews.title: Go back year after year,so clean so friendly getting ready to go back soon

reviews.text: Love the place, love the family, cleaner than my home!!! Very inviting, friendly atmosphere. Any time we come to Lancaster, there is no other place to stay! If rooms are not available when we want to come in, we change our plans to fit their availability. Started coming there before the "Girls" took over - when Mom & Dad still ran the place! Now we are on the 3 generation.
reviews.title: Haven't stayed anywhere else in over 20 Years!

reviews.text: I had read the previous reviews on Garden Spot Motel and wanted to check it out for myself. I must say that the overall property, grounds, and the room itself {#36} were amazingly clean. Very clean. There is a large, safe parking lot, with parking spots for each room. The motel's coffeeshop is very cozy and inviting looking and serves breakfast for those that are interested. We missed out. I feel that they could take in a lot of outside business and maximize their "city ledger" sales by advertising more. The coffee shop is relatively small but very cute and functionable. There is a vending area and a gathering room, in which coffee and tea are complimentary from 630-930 every evening. The Gathering Room has games to play, books and newspapers to read, and a lot of information about the Amish nicely arranged to look at. Garden Spot is centrally located to the Amish and to the outlets for shopping, as well as close by to other attractions. Although the establishment is situated on Lincoln Highway, the traffic noise was minimal. Once inside the room, it was extremely quiet and peaceful. Outside night time light was minimal and the room was very dark, which makes for great sleeping conditions. The sheets were very soft and made of good material, although the beds were extremely hard and the pillows were very thin. I was really hurting the following morning. I also feel that new blankets and covers should be ordered immediately because they are pretty rough. That really totally sucks because overall, it would of been a nice stay. Each room offers cold A/C, a hairdryer, and an iron, excellent tv and a nice table and two chairs. Nice looking furniture as well. Aside from the bathroom, the room was overall decorated with theme and charm in mind. There wasn't a frig in our room however I am not sure about the other rooms. The bathrooms were immaculate and very clean. Nice soft towels and plenty of them. The tub/shower offers a nice little touch.....Eurobath, which is foam that works for shampoo/body. Smells very nice and works easier than slippery soap. I will go back to stay again, considering the fact that the bedding situation becomes better. Much better. They have a nice little business and lodging establishment to offer. Rates are reasonably priced considering it is still "in season". Personally if I had the place, I'd get better beds/bedding for the rooms and then up the rates a dollar or two per night to cover the expenses if I had to. And as a customer, I'd pay a few dollars more a night to stay if the bedding situation was in fact better. Within a short amount of time, it'd pay for itself and business would probably dramatically increase by the advertisement of new beds.
reviews.title: Nice Play

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, very clean little room! Reception staff was very nice and check in went smoothly. Average room rate. Probably woundn't stay here again because of the road noise.
reviews.title: Adequate spot for 1 night

reviews.text: We came back to Lancaster again and got to stay here. Nothing to complain about room very clean, front desk service excellent, room rate reasonable. Again excellent job ladies.
reviews.title: Another great stay!!

reviews.text: Nice very little room, but the downside is that the motel, like other places on that road, is right on a busy highway. I masked the noise by the fan at night. Good service. A good choice for someone on a budget.
reviews.title: Nice Place on Busy Road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate that there was a cancellation and we got a room.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The property is well maintained and exceptionally clean.
reviews.title: A gem of a motel in Lancaster

reviews.text: I stayed here for the weekend while visiting Dutch Wonderland, which is just up the road. The rate was reasonable and close to the main attractions, even if the road is busy. The rooms were also pretty decent too, although they did not provide any shampoo, but otherwise everything was fine. Breakfast is available next to the lobby and the prices are very reasonable. I would certainly go back next time I visit Dutch Wonderland.
reviews.title: Decent Stay

reviews.text: The Garden Spot is a nice clean little family run motel. The rates are reasonable and the rooms very clean. The staff is very helpful. We have stayed here over 6 times during the last few years when in Lancaster. I always regret when it is closed during the winter months but know I'll have a place in the spring if needed. During our recent stay with our son and grandson ( a toddler), it was nice to have a room with 2 double beds and a single.
reviews.title: Nice Family Run Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice little motel for a night's stay. It's clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, but they're only there certain hours of the day. It has TV and WiFi, and not much else. No fridge or microwave. The bathroom is situated right next to the outside door and the window of the bathroom faces the parking lot, so that if people are out there or walking about you don't have the privacy you'd like. And it's small. The bed was comfortable, and there's a nice size table and wing back chairs which was nice. They supply an iron and ironing board and hair dryer. Another plus is that even though it's on Route 30 with heavy traffic, you get very little road noise.
reviews.title: Depends on what you're used to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a coffee shop on the premises as well, but we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Hard to make a left from onto 30

reviews.text: I would recommend it for a night or if you're on a tight budget. The rooms are reasonable.
reviews.title: A good, basic motel

reviews.text: Nice, clean room. Good price. Really enjoyed having windows that actually opened and looked out onto a nice lawn and flowering bushes. However, getting out onto 30 during a busy weekend was difficult. Might stay again during the week or off season. On season, we'll stay somewhere where there's a light to get out onto 30 or off 30. It was clean though, and good for the budget traveler. Close to Dutch Wonderland, if you're into that.
reviews.title: Great Value for the Price. We'll be back.
